intro: Daviesia ternata, commonly known as the yellow hill myrtle, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It is often found in heathlands and open forests, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
